{"step_by_step_thinking": "Christmas disease, also known as Hemophilia B, is a genetic disorder caused by a deficiency of a specific clotting factor. This factor is not related to platelets, plasma thromboplastin antecedent, or plasma thromboplastin component. The factor that is deficient in Christmas disease is Factor IX, also known as the Hageman Factor.", "answer_choice": "A"}
